p: The main source of ursane-derived triterpenes ( Figure 4) with high efficiency in the treatment of wounds is Indian pennywort, Centella asiatica (L.) Urb. (syn. Hydrocotyle asiatica L.), a plant of Asian origin belonging to the Apiaceae family. Its leaves contain triterpenes of the ursane series (asiaticoside, asiatic acid, madecassoside, madecassic acid) and the oleanane series, as well as other secondary metabolites like chlorogenic acids, flavonoids, sterols and essential oils [ 45].
